cyclone.name: MICHAEL
cyclone.current_location: about 455 mi south of Panama City, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to move north–northwest through the eastern Gulf, make landfall on the Florida Panhandle, then accelerate northeast across the Southeast U.S. and emerge off the Mid-Atlantic coast, passing just southeast of New England as a post-tropical cyclone.

weather_observation.watch_coast: None (watches confined to northeastern Gulf Coast)
weather_observation.warning_coast: None (warnings confined to northeastern Gulf Coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northeastern Gulf Coast, then inland across GA–SC–NC and eventually the Mid-Atlantic and southern New England coastline including Cape Cod and Massachusetts Bay
weather_observation.wind: Low (4%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds late Friday into early Saturday; gusty winds 25–35 kt with higher gusts possible as the system races offshore.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge possible in Massachusetts Bay, generally below 3 ft.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain with isolated 6 inch totals could cause localized urban and coastal flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along the Massachusetts coastline Friday–Saturday.
